intro: Pluchea rosea var. mexicana, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and along streambanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a dense cluster. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
